get.summary: Request information regarding the trading volume for a specific date. The request returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per token.

parameters.description: The year of the specific trading volume request date - in this case 2020.
parameters.name: year

parameters.description: The month of the specific trading volume request date - in this case 01 (January).
parameters.name: month

parameters.description: The day of the specific trading volume request date - in this case 01 (1st of a month).
parameters.name: day

default.description: Returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per trading pair.

get.summary: Request information regarding the trading volume of a specific address for the last 30 days. The request returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per token. Results are cached for 60 minutes.

default.description: Returns the trading volume of the last 30 days for a specific address. The request returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per trading pair. Results are cached for 60 minutes.

get.summary: This returns a user ranking by overall trading volume quoted in USD. If the parameters startDate and endDate are provided, the ranking includes only trading volume within that window of time.

parameters.description: The start date and time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds) for which the trade volumes are requested. If startDate and endDate are not provided, it returns the volume ranking if all time.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The end date and time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds) for which events are requested.If startDate and endDate are not provided, it returns the volume ranking if all time.
parameters.name: endDate

default.description: Ranked output of all trading volumes for all the tokens.

get.summary: Returns a countdown until the expected next batch proof is submitted onto the blockchain and the average time of previous batches. The next batch will include all pending withdrawals.

default.description: Returns the amount of time remaining until the batch is posted to Ethereum.

get.summary: Return current fee rate for a given address. This rate is dependent on user trading volume.

parameters.name: nonce
parameters.description: This nonce which used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

default.description: Returns the fee rate for the user based on past trading volume.

get.summary: Request information regarding the trading volume for the last 24 hours. The request returns the overall trading volume details in USD as well as the trading volume per token in USD and the native token.

default.description: Returns the trading volume of the last 24 hours.

get.summary: This returns a user ranking by trading volume for a chosen token. If the parameters startDate and endDate are provided, the ranking includes only trading volume within that window of time. All volumes are quoted in ETH.

parameters.description: The currency relating to the requested trading volume information.
parameters.name: currency

parameters.description: The start date and time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds) for which the trade volumes are requested. If startDate and endDate are not provided, it returns the volume ranking if all time.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The end date and time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds) for which the trade volumes are requested. If startDate and endDate are not provided, it returns the volume ranking if all time.
parameters.name: endDate

default.description: Returns a ranked output of all the trading volumes for a given crypto currency. All the Volumes are quoted in ETH.

post.summary: This is used to retrieve the total and active balances of a user per token. Active balance is the balance that is currently available. Total balance (specified as balance) is the sum of all the balances including those locked for trading.

default.description: Returns the total and active balances of a user per token.

post.summary: Returns the DeversiFi application configuration details.

default.description: Returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per trading pair.

post.summary: This is an authenticated endpoint used to retrieve deposits. A token can be specified to get deposits for a specific token. The limit of deposits returned is 1000.

parameters.description: Date of the last deposit returned.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: Limit of deposits that will be returned. With a maximum limit of 1000.
parameters.name: limit

default.description: Returns the list of deposits. A token can be specified to get deposits for a specific token.

post.summary: This is endpoint is used to retrieve the details for a specific order using the order ID.

default.description: Returns details relating to a particular order.

post.summary: This endpoint is used to retrieve all pending withdrawals. If a token is specified, withdrawals pertaining to only that particular token are provided.

default.description: Successful

post.summary: Returns the DeversiFi application and user configuration details.

default.description: Returns the overall trading volume details for all tokens in USD as well as the trading volume per trading pair.

post.summary: An authenticated endpoint used to retrieve a vaultId for given token.

default.description: Returns a the vault id allocated for the requested token.

post.summary: This endpoint is used to retrieve details relating to a particular withdrawal.

default.description: Returns details relating to a particular withdrawal.

post.summary: This endpoints allows to retrieve details on all open orders.

default.description: Returns all open orders.

post.summary: This method is used to retrieve a list of all past orders for a user. This includes executed trades, as well as expired and cancelled orders. The limit of orders returned is 1000.

parameters.description: Date of the last order returned.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: Limit of orders that will be returned. With a maximum limit of 1000.
parameters.name: limit

default.description: Returns a list of all a user's past orders.

post.summary: An authenticated endpoint used to retrieve a list of user's past withdrawals. This includes ready, completed, as well as cancelled withdrawals. The limit of withdrawals returned is 1000.

parameters.description: Date of the last withdraw returned.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: Limit of withdraws that will be returned. With a maximum limit of 1000.
parameters.name: limit

default.description: Returns a list of user's past withdrawals.

post.summary: This endpoint allows to cancel a specific order.

default.description: Returns the order ID of the cancelled order.

post.summary: Submit a signed notification of a new deposit made.

default.description: Returns the deposit notifcation.

post.summary: This method is used to register a Stark key that corresponds to an Ethereum public address. This will return deversifi Signature or DeversiFi application and user configuration details.

default.description: Returns a Deversifi Signature (defiSignature) which is required to register on StarkEx Smart Contract. Returns the DeversiFi application as well as the user configuration details if use is already registered.

post.summary: This authenticated endpoint is used to submit an order.

default.description: Returns the order ID of the submitted order.

post.summary: Submit a request for a new withdrawal.

default.description: Successful

post.summary: Returns a range of gas prices in Wei to use with on chain transactions.

default.description: Range of gas prices for on chain confirmation speed.

get.summary: Request information regarding all recently completed trades for a given market pair.

parameters.name: Symbol
parameters.description: The market trading pair in deversifi format i.e BASE:QUOTE

default.description: The trades endpoint returns data on all recently completed trades for a given market pair for the past 24 hours.

get.summary: Request information regarding all completed trades in a time range for a given market pair

parameters.name: Symbol
parameters.description: The market trading pair in deversifi format i.e BASE:QUOTE

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: The Unix timestamp in milliseconds for the start period for the query.

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: Optional, current Unix timestamp in milliseconds is used if this parameter is not provided. The Unix timestamp in milliseconds for the end period for the query.

default.description: Returns data on all recently completed trades for a given market pair during a time range.

nonce.description: This nonce which used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

token.description: The new token for which a new vault Id needs to be allocated.

properties.description: The vault id for the requested vault.

TotalUSDValue.description: The total trade volume in terms of USD.

startDate.description: The start date and time for the volume presented.

endDate.description: The end date and time for the volume presented.

address.description: The Ethereum address of the user verified by nonce and signature.

maker.description: The fee basis points for maker orders (adding bids or offers to the order book).

taker.description: The fee basis points for taker orders (removing liquidity from the order book).

TotalUSDValue.description: The total trade volume in terms of USD.

startDate.description: The start date and time for the volume presented.

endDate.description: The end date and time for the volume presented.

USDValue.description: The trading volume for the address quoted in USD.

estimatedTime.description: The number of seconds until the batch is sent to be processed and broadcast to the blockchain.

averageTime.description: The configured number of seconds between batches.

finalisedBatchPendingConfirmation.description: True if the previous batch has been created but still pending confirmation on the blockchain.'

TotalUSDValue.description: The total trade volume in terms of USD.

startDate.description: The start date and time for the volume presented.

amount.description: The trading volume for the address

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

token.description: The token which the balance is specifically requested for.

balance.description: It is the total balance available for the user corresponding to the specified token.

activeBalance.description: It is the active balance available for the user corresponding to the specified token.

ethAddress.description: The ethereum public address of the user.

token.description: The token for which the balances are provided.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the withdrawal.

readyToWithdrawOnChain.description: The withdrawal is ready to be requested.

DVF.description: This contains application configuration details to set up for deposits and trading.

defaultFeeRate.description: The default fee rate, if no volume or maker discount.

deversifiAddress.description: The address of the DeversiFi exchange.

exchangeSymbols.description: Currency pairs available at the DeversiFi exchange for trading

tempStarkVaultId.description: Transit Stark vault ID used for deposit privacy

tokenRegistry.description: Detailed information related to each available token.

ethAddress.description: The ethereum public address of the user.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the deposit.

isPostedOffchain.description: Flag to indicate if the deposit was posted off chain.

isConfirmedOnChain.description: Flag to indicate if the deposit was confirmed off chain.

orderId.description: The ID of the order. In case you want to view all open orders, check POST openOrders.

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

_id.description: Id for the order. This can be used for orderId when calling cancelOrder or getOrder

nonce.description: This nonce is used to provide the time until which this nonce is valid. It is presented as seconds since epoch.

signature.description: The signature obtained by signing the nonce with your private ethereum key.

token.description: The token that will be withdrawn.

signature.description: The signed hash (signature) received during the pre-registration process.

withdrawalId.description: Used to identify a specific withdrawal.

_id.description: Id for the order. This can be used for orderId when calling cancelOrder or getOrder

pair.description: The trading pair that was used for this order.

_id.description: Order Id, this can be used as orderId when calling cancelOrder or getOrder.

symbol.description: The trading pair symbol for this order.

tokenBuy.description: Token being bought as part of this exchange order.

totalBought.description: Total tokens bought, in quantized units.

tokenSell.description: Token being sold as part of this exchange order.

totalSold.description: Total tokens sold, in quantized units.

type.description: Type of the order. Currently, "EXCHANGE LIMIT" is the only type that is supported.

averagePrice.description: Average price at which the order has been settled.

feeRate.description: The max fee rate applicable for the order.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the order was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the order was last updated.

activatedAt.description: The date and time when the order was activated.

y.description: The "y" part of the Stark public key.

starkSignature.description: Stark signature consisting of consisting of "r", "s" and the recovery parameter.

r.description: The "r" part of the Stark signature.

s.description: The "s" part of the Stark signature.

recoveryParam.description: The recovery parameter of the Stark signature.

tokenBuy.description: The token which is being bought

amount.description: Original order size placed being sold or bought.

s.description: The "s" part of the Stark signature.

recoveryParam.description: The recovery parameter of the Stark signature.

fast.description: Gas price in Wei for quickest onchain transaction confirmation.

average.description: Average gas price in Wei for average onchain transaction speed.

cheap.description: Low gas price in Wei and very slow transaction speed.

fastWait.description: The approximate time for a transaction confirmation when using fast as the gas price.

averageWait.description: The approximate time for a transaction confirmation when using average as the gas price.

cheapWait.description: The approximate time for a transaction confirmation when using cheap as the gas price.

trade_id.description: A unique ID associated with the trade for the currency pair transaction

price.description: Last transacted price of base currency based on given quote currency.

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp in milliseconds for when the transaction occurred.

type.description: Used to determine whether or not the transaction originated as a buy or sell.
